text: Dolores Mercedes Koch (née Gonzalez, 1928 - 11 June 2009) was a Cuban American literary critic and translator who was a pioneer in the area of microfiction. == Biography == Koch was born in Havana, Cuba in 1928. Dolores Koch received her PhD in Latin American Literature from the City University of New York, and in addition to her work on microfiction, translated to English several important Spanish-language works, including those of Laura Restrepo, Jorge Bucay, Alina Fernández, Emily Schindler, Enrique Joven, and her compatriot Reinaldo Arenas, whose work Before Night Falls was adapted to a film of the same name. Her article (in Spanish) "El micro-relato en México: Torri, Arreola, Monterroso y Avilés Fabila", published in 1981, is the first critical work on microfiction in the Spanish-speaking world. Koch died at her home in New York on 11 June 2009. == References == == Further reading== * https://rbsc.princeton.edu/collections/dolores-koch-collection-reinaldo-arenas Category:1928 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Writers from Havana Category:Cuban emigrants to the United States Category:Spanish–English translators Category:American literary critics Category:Women literary critics Category:City University of New York alumni Category:20th-century American women writers Category:American writers of Cuban descent Category:20th-century Cuban women writers Category:20th-century translators Category:20th-century American writers Category:20th-century Cuban writers
